title: Learning Theory of Distribution Regression with Neural Networks. (arXiv:2307.03487v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: In this paper, we aim at establishing an approximation theory and a learning theory of distribution regression via a fully connected neural network (FNN). In contrast to the classical regression methods, the input variables of distribution regression are probability measures. Then we often need to perform a second-stage sampling process to approximate the actual information of the distribution. On the other hand, the classical neural network structure requires the input variable to be a vector. When the input samples are probability distributions, the traditional deep neural network method cannot be directly used and the difficulty arises for distribution regression. A well-defined neural network structure for distribution inputs is intensively desirable. There is no mathematical model and theoretical analysis on neural network realization of distribution regression. To overcome technical difficulties and address this issue, we establish a novel fully connected neural network framework

translated_title: 分布回归的神经网络学习理论
translated_abstract: 本文旨在通过全连接神经网络（FNN）建立分布回归的逼近理论和学习理论。与传统回归方法不同的是，分布回归的输入变量是概率测度。然后我们常常需要进行二阶段抽样过程来近似分布的实际信息。另一方面，传统的神经网络结构要求输入变量为向量。当输入样本是概率分布时，传统的深度神经网络方法无法直接使用，分布回归问题变得困难。因此，一个对于分布输入进行明确定义的神经网络结构是非常需求的。关于分布回归的神经网络实现没有数学模型和理论分析。为了克服技术难题并解决这个问题，我们建立了一个新颖的全连接神经网络框架。
tldr: 本文提出了一个全连接神经网络框架用于分布回归问题，解决了传统神经网络无法直接处理概率分布输入的困难，并建立了逼近理论和学习理论。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a fully connected neural network framework for distribution regression, addressing the difficulty of traditional neural networks in handling probability distribution inputs and establishing approximation theory and learning theory.
